sentence.Network_en: She watches television to relieve the monotony of everyday life.
sentence.Network_cn: 她天天靠看电视来解闷儿。

sentence.Network_en: They broke the monotony of the weary journey with songs and jokes.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们唱歌或说笑话使这个令人疲惫的旅程不至于单调乏味.

sentence.Network_en: The rooms are admirably cool and shady after the hot brown monotony of the countryside.
sentence.Network_cn: 在乡间经受过持续的暴晒后，房间里显得特别阴凉宜人。

entry.tran: 单调乏味;无变化;一成不变
entry.def: The monotony of something is the fact that it never changes and is boring.

example.ex: A night on the town may help to break the monotony of the week.
example.tran: 进城住一晚或许有助于消除一周生活的单调。

means.word_mean: 1. the quality of wearisome constancy and lack of variety;

sentences.sentence: "he had never grown accustomed to the monotony of his work"
"he hated the sameness of the food the college served"

means.word_mean: 2. constancy of tone or pitch or inflection
